titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the George Van Santvoord Collection
titlestmt.author: by Beinecke Staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The George Van Santvoord collection was formed by Van Santvoord's relatives, friends and associates. Various early acquisitions include manuscript material by Van Santvoord and others, correspondence, and printed material. Sketchbooks contain original ink and pencil sketches and watercolors, with views of places visited by Van Santvoord in South Africa, the Far East, Panama Canal, Galapagos, Marquesas, Bora Bora, Tahiti, Fiji, Borneo, and elsewhere. The July 1985 Acquisition contains correspondence, including letters from Van Santvoord to his father Seymour, dating from 1914 to 1918, and letters to Van Santvoord from Lancelot Ridley Phelps, William Lyon Phelps, Harris Rackham, and others. The October 1995 Acquisition contains manuscript notes relating to John Milton and the seventeeth century, additional correspondence, material relating to Yale University, dating largely from the 1940s, and other personal papers.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Acquired from various sources. For more information consult the appropriate curator.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The George Van Santvoord Collection is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: George Van Santvoord Collection. Yale Collection of American Literature, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection received a basic level of processing, including rehousing and in some instances minimal organization. Various acquisitions associated with the collection have not been merged and organized as a whole. Each acquisition is described separately in the contents list below, identified by a unique call number and titled according to month and year of acquisition.
This finding aid may be updated to account for revisions in arrangement and description.
Former call numbers: Za Van Santvoord, Uncat Za Ms 337, Uncat Za Ms 87, Uncat Za File 253, and Uncat Za Ms 456.

bioghist.head: George Van Santvoord (1891-1975)
bioghist.p: George Van Santvoord was born in Bennington, Vermont on 5 August, 1891 and educated at Hotchkiss School, Yale University (1912), and Oxford Univeristy. After serving with the American Field Service and 39th U.S. Infantry, Van Santvoord taught English at Yale (1919-1921) and at the University of Buffalo (1922-1925). Van Santvoord then returned to Hotchkiss School, a preparatory school in Lakeville, Connecticut, to serve as Headmaster, a post he held from 1926 to 1955. Upon his retirement, he served in the Vermont legislature for ten years. Van Santvoord died in Williamstown, Massachusetts on 19 Februrary 1975.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The George Van Santvoord collection was formed by Mr. Van Santvoord's relatives, friends and associates. Various early acquisitions include manuscript material by Van Santvoord and others, correspondence, and printed material. Sketchbooks contain original ink and pencil sketches and watercolors, with views of places visited by Van Santvoord in South Africa, the Far East, Panama Canal, Galapagos, Marquesas, Bora Bora, Tahiti, Fiji, Borneo, and elsewhere. The July 1985 Acquisition contains correspondence, including letters from Van Santvoord to his father Seymour, dating from 1914 to 1918, and letters to Van Santvoord from Lancelot Ridley Phelps, William Lyon Phelps, Harris Rackham, and others. The October 1995 Acquisition contains manuscript notes relating to John Milton and the seventeenth century, additional correspondence, material relating to Yale University, dating largely from the 1940s, and other personal papers.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into five groupings: Early Acquisitions, July 1985 Acquisition, January 1989 Acquisition, November 1990 Acquisition, and October 1995 Acquisition.

controlaccess.geogname: Marquesas Islands (French Polynesia) -- Description and travel
Tahiti (French Polynesia : Island) -- Description and travel

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into three subdivisions: Manuscripts, Correspondence, and Printed Material.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Early Acquisitions include manuscript material by Van Santvoord and others, correspondence, and printed material. Sketchbooks contain original pencil and ink sketches and watercolors, with views of places visited by Van Santvoord while on a tour, including South Africa, the Far East, Panama Canal, Galapagos, Marquesas, Bora Bora, Tahiti, Fiji, Borneo, and elsewhere.
Former call number: Za Van Santvoord.
Acquired from various sources. For more information consult the appropriate curator.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by letter general folders and correspondent.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The July 1985 Acquisition contains correspondence, including letters from Van Santvoord to his father Seymour, dating from 1914 to 1918, and letters to Van Santvoord from Lancelot Ridley Phelps, William Lyon Phelps, Harris Rackham, and others.
Former call number: Uncat Za Ms 337.
Gift of John G. Bowen, 1985.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by letter general folder and name.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The January 1989 Acquisition contains additional correspondence.
Former call number: Uncat Za Ms 87.
Gift of John G. Bowen, 1989.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The November 1990 Acquisition contains a single autograph letter, signed, from George Van Santvoord to "Jack" expressing gratitude for a letter.
Former call number: Uncat Za File 253.
Gift of John G. Bowen, 1990.

did.unittitle: Autograph letter, signed, from Van Santvoord to "Jack"

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Files not arranged in any particular order.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The October 1995 Acquisition contains manuscript notes relating to John Milton and the seventeenth century, correspondence, papers relating to Van Santvoord's involvement with Yale University, dating largely from the 1940s, and other personal papers. The Yale University material includes documentation from an Educational Policy Committee, Finance Committee, the Yale Corporation, and other offices.
Former call number: Uncat Za Ms 456.
Gift of The Hotchkiss School, 1995.

did.unittitle: Material relating to Milton and the 17th century
Oxford University Press correspondence and proofs
